sen.j: 松山 幾之助（まつやま いくのすけ、生年不詳 - 元治元年7月6日 (旧暦)（1864年8月7日））は新選組隊士。
sen.e: Ikunosuke MATSUYAMA (year of birth unknown-August 7, 1864) was a member of Shinsengumi (special police who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
Ikunosuke MATSUYAMA (year of birth unknown-August 7, 1864) was a member of Shinsengumi (special police who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

sen.j: 1864年7月6日、松山は、新選組の密偵として西国の動きを探るため、岡山奥市谷に潜入していたが、岡元太郎ら7名の浪士に斬殺され、一本松の御成橋に梟首される。
sen.e: On August 6, 1864, Matsuyama, who had been stationed to Okuichiya, Okayama (Prefecture), as Shinsengumi's spy to investigate into the movement in the western regions, was murdered by seven roshi (masterless samurai) represented by Taro OKAMOTO, and his head was shown in public at the Onari Bridge in Ipponmatsu.

sen.j: 襲撃者のうち岡元ら4名は後に自首のうえ赦免された。
sen.e: The four of the assassins, including OKAMOTO, voluntarily went to the police later and were pardoned.

sen.e: Another brief says that the date of his death was May 11, or August 8.
